info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson, western Polk and north central Greenville Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Hendersonville, or near Flat Rock, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Columbus, Flat Rock, Laurel Park, Tryon, Saluda, Tigerville, Valley Hill, Tuxedo and North Saluda Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
